summary: This is an FBI internal request form from the Miami Division to the Document Conversion Laboratory (DocLab) and the Special Technologies and Applications Office (STAG) to process telephone records related to an obstruction of justice investigation. The records are connected to a former house manager/butler of Jeffrey Epstein who allegedly attempted to sell an address book containing potential victim information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: The document states the obstruction of justice case is related to his former house manager/butler, and the address book in question contains names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein.

events.title: Miami Division opens obstruction of justice case
events.description: The Miami Division of the FBI opened an obstruction of justice case against an unnamed subject, identified as the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The FBI Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case in October 2009 against Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager and butler.

The subject of the investigation allegedly came into possession of an address book containing names and telephone numbers of what are believed to be additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

The subject allegedly attempted to sell the address book to an unspecified party ('a LICE') rather than turn it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas from pending civil litigation.
The document is a request to process telephone records (target number 340-771-4897) from the address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims.
The document reveals the FBI's use of an internal system called 'Baleen Sweep' and the 'Telephone Application (TA)' as a centralized repository for scanned intelligence information.
